SEARCH

Class Canvas

java.lang.Object
Canvas
public class Canvas extends Object
This canvas class produces paintings according to an input source image, the painting process can be multi-threaded by locking the canvas array, but it can be problematic and would also break the ability to produce identical results given a set random seed...

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    Clear()
    Clear the canvas
    void
    FillBackground(int[][][] canvas, int offset)
    Fill the unpainted areas (not all black areas are unpainted!), this implementation implements region growing via Breath-First Search: every pixel in the canvas is checked to see if it's unpainted (pixel value = 0, 0, 0), while there are still unpainted pixels in the input canvas, it would select the first unpainted pixel found as a new seed and use BFS to grow the region until all neighbouring unpainted pixels are grouped together this process is repeated until all pixels are checked, each region is then filled with the average colour of the corresponding pixels in the source image
    int[][][]
    GaussianBlur(int[][][] canvas, int sigma)
    Apply gaussian blur to a canvas (a colour image) with a standard deviation of sigma
    int[][][]
    NormalizeCanvas(int[][][] canvas, int offset)
    Normalize all pixels' RGB values in a canvas from [offset, 255+offset] to the [0, 255] range, the offset value is used to differentiate the painted black pixels with the unpainted pixels: since a stroke of pure black (0, 0, 0) is incremented to (offset, offset, offset), the pixels that are still pure black (0, 0, 0) are unpainted
    void

      public void SetUpCompactBrush(int[][][][] compactBrushes, int[] scaledSize0, int[] diagLen0)
      Set up the compact brush for the canvas
      Parameters:
      compactBrushes - an array of brushes of different scales and orientations, array shape = (scales, orientations)
      scaledSize0 - size of the original brush
      diagLen0 - size of the rotated brushes

      diagLen1 - size of the rotated brushes

    • PaintStrokes

      public void PaintStrokes(int brushType, int i, long N, boolean noisyStroke)
      Paint all the strokes of a given size of a given brush, if the edge magnitude corresponds to i and the thresholded MDoG value is appropriate (compact: 0, elongated: 255)

      s | i | Size | Magnitude

      4 | 0 | 5/5 |[ 0, 51]

      3 | 1 | 4/5 |[ 52, 102]

      2 | 2 | 3/5 |[103, 153]

      1 | 3 | 2/5 |[154, 204]

      0 | 4 | 1/5 |[205, 255]

      Parameters:
      brushType - 0 for compact brush, 1 for elongated brush
      i - index of brush
      N - number of positions to consider painting a stroke
      noisyStroke - whether the stroke's colour should be noisy

    • Paint

      public void Paint(int brushType, int s, double edgeOrientation, int x, int y, boolean noisyStroke)
      Attempt to paint a stroke at position (x, y) with a brush with size (s+1)/5 of the original, the stroke is only painted if it improves the canvas's similarity with the source image, the colour of the stroke is an average of all the pixels it masks in the source image, the colour is increased by 1 in each channel to assist the detection of unpainted areas (e.g. if the average colour is pure black, it is painted as [1, 1, 1])

      If the user has specifed that they want a noisy rendering, then the stroke's colour when evaluating whether it improves the canvas's similarity with the source image is normal, but the final painted stroke colour of smaller strokes (1/5, 2/5, 3/5 of the original brush size) would be an average of all the pixels masked by the stroke in the noisy version of the source image

      Parameters:
      brushType - 0 for compact brush, 1 for elongated brush
      s - size of the brush to use,
      edgeOrientation - sobel orientation of the source image at position (x, y)
      x - row-position of the proposed stroke on canvas
      y - column-position of the proposed stroke on canvas
      noisyStroke - whether the stroke's colour should be noisy

    • FillBackground

      public void FillBackground(int[][][] canvas, int offset)
      Fill the unpainted areas (not all black areas are unpainted!), this implementation implements region growing via Breath-First Search: every pixel in the canvas is checked to see if it's unpainted (pixel value = 0, 0, 0), while there are still unpainted pixels in the input canvas, it would select the first unpainted pixel found as a new seed and use BFS to grow the region until all neighbouring unpainted pixels are grouped together this process is repeated until all pixels are checked, each region is then filled with the average colour of the corresponding pixels in the source image
      Parameters:
      canvas - input canvas
      offset - the offset value of all pixels in the canvas, used to assist unpainted area detection

    • NormalizeCanvas

      public int[][][] NormalizeCanvas(int[][][] canvas, int offset)
      Normalize all pixels' RGB values in a canvas from [offset, 255+offset] to the [0, 255] range, the offset value is used to differentiate the painted black pixels with the unpainted pixels: since a stroke of pure black (0, 0, 0) is incremented to (offset, offset, offset), the pixels that are still pure black (0, 0, 0) are unpainted
      Parameters:
      canvas - input canvas
      offset - the offset value of all pixels in the canvas, used to assist unpainted area detection
      Returns:
      int[][][] the canvas with all pixels' RGB values normalized to [0, 255]

    • GaussianBlur

      public int[][][] GaussianBlur(int[][][] canvas, int sigma)
      Apply gaussian blur to a canvas (a colour image) with a standard deviation of sigma
      Parameters:
      canvas - a colour image
      sigma - standard deviation
      Returns:
      int[][][] blurred image

    • RenderImages

      public void RenderImages()
      Render all of the resulting images and save them separately

      (The following images are always rendered)

      - Result.ppm: the painted image

      - Result-filled.ppm: the painted image with all unpainted pixels filled

      (Optional gaussian-blurred images if -g flag is used when running Relaxation)

      - Result-blur.ppm: blurred version of the painted image

      - Result-filled-blur.ppm: blurred version of the painted image with unpainted pixels filled
